revised_title: Late-Quaternary Deposit Analysis at Roddans Port on the North-East Coast of Ireland
tldr: The article discusses a submerged Late-Quaternary deposit at Roddans Port on the north-east coast of Ireland. The deposit's stratigraphy and the pollen, plant, and animal remains found within it provide evidence for the Late-glacial and Post-glacial environmental history of the region. The research confirms the age attribution of the deposit and offers insights into the marine and freshwater conditions during the Late-glacial period.
